subject: Art
title: Building a Digital Portfolio
description: Showcasing your best digital art professionally.

hook.text: Your portfolio is your resume as an artist. It's not a gallery of everything you've ever made ‚Äî it's a curated selection of your best work that shows what you can do and what you want to do more of.

buildup.text: Portfolio rules: quality over quantity (10-20 pieces maximum), lead with your strongest work, show consistency in style and quality, include process shots, and target the type of work you want.

discovery.text: Platform options: ArtStation (industry standard for entertainment art), Behance (design-focused), personal website (full control), and Instagram (discovery and community). ArtStation and a personal site cover most needs.

twist.text: Your weakest piece sets the bar for your portfolio. Adding a mediocre piece to pad numbers hurts more than helps. Better to have 8 great pieces than 20 mixed ones. Edit ruthlessly.

climax.text: Start your portfolio: pick your 10 strongest pieces, present them professionally (clean backgrounds, good mockups), write brief descriptions, and publish on ArtStation or a simple website.

punchline.text: Show only your best. Your portfolio is a highlight reel, not a complete filmography.

quiz.question: Why should you limit your portfolio to your best work only?
options: Your weakest piece sets the perceived quality bar ‚Äî mediocre work lowers the overall impression
